The Advancing Unmanned Delivery Services Act is part of a legislative package to ensure American leadership in emerging technology to beat China and to tackle other challenges to global competitiveness.

Analyzing the potential of unmanned delivery services and identifying regulatory obstacles will facilitate the safe incorporation of these devices into our everyday lives, & ensure the United States remains a global leader in innovation.

#COVID19 highlighted the importance of delivering goods Americans rely on directly to their homes. Unmanned delivery services, including drones, robots, & autonomous vehicles, unleash the potential to ensure Americans can access necessities from the comfort of their living rooms.
Today, I introduced the Advancing Unmanned Delivery Services Act, legislation which evaluates the many benefits contactless delivery has for various segments & sectors of our country.

4‚É£The Paycheck Recovery Act will do all of this while covering more than 36 million workers and costing less than what has already been spent on two rounds of Paycheck Protection Program loans, which have failed to successfully stabilize unemployment.

3‚É£The Act also covers a portion of businesses' operating costs such as rent to ensure they can re-open when the pandemic ends.
 
And at a time when more than 100,000 small businesses have closed, it does this without picking winners and losers, covering businesses of all sizes.

2‚É£HR 6918 is not just an economic recovery plan; it‚Äôs a public health plan too. At a time when at least 27 million people have lost health care during #COVID19, this bill also covers the costs of returning workers to their employer-sponsored benefits, including health insurance.

1‚É£The Paycheck Recovery Act keeps workers connected to their paychecks by covering the wages of those earning up to $90,000.
